column1: 10 pts - Great job identifying the business function that could benefit from scrum/sprint methodologies and explaining how it could operate for that function. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how scrum/sprint could operate. Great job in explaining the process and its benefits for the chosen business function. Keep up the good work!

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit.

Comment: Good effort in explaining the benefits of scrum/sprint and kanban for different functions, but could provide more clarity on why kanban is a poor fit for the chosen function.

10 pts - Great job identifying the marketing function as a suitable candidate for implementing kanban methodologies and providing a detailed explanation of how it could operate. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how kanban could operate. Great job on providing specific details and examples for the marketing function. Keep up the good work!
7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit. Good effort, but try to provide more specific examples of why scrum/sprint is a poor fit for the function.

5 pts - Selected bias is clearly relevant to this situation.

Great job identifying confirmation bias as a potential issue in Jackson's decision-making process. Keep up the good work!
10/10 - Excellent job defining confirmation bias and providing a clear example of how it could impact the decision-making process. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Complete and clear description of possible problem. Great job in addressing the potential issues and providing detailed explanations. Keep up the good work!
10/10 - Excellent job providing a clear and complete description of possible steps and actions. Keep up the great work!
